author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Boogie-Down Halloween in Belfast
text:
Boogie-Down Halloween in Belfast Oct 22, 2015 Photo by: Alex Chapin Belfast Poet Laureate Toussaint St. Negritude is throwing a Boogie-Down Halloween Night party at Waterfall Arts Oct. 31. 
Belfast — Everyone is invited to gather up their wildest creativity, throw on their coolest concoctions of finery — sweetly frightful or darkly delightful — and party during the Boogie-Down Halloween Night Saturday, Oct. 31, in the Fallout Shelter of Waterfall Arts, 256 High St., from 6 to 10 p.m. 
There will be multiple performances by a host of bands, poets, DJs and others. Suggested donation will be $10, although all donations small and kindly large will be dearly accepted. All proceeds will go towards the purchase of a reliable car for Belfast Poet Laureate Toussaint St. Negritude, whose valiant jalopy has given up the proverbial ghost. A selection of his handmade hats and items will be for sale, and the best-costumed partier will receive the coolest hat of all. 
St. Negritude invites one and all to shake a leg, and shake the blues away, saying “I love the blues, but it's time to party on to some better driving days!” For more information, email stnegritude@gmail.com. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
